inclusion.criterion: Newborn infants admitted anywhere in the Neonate unit or Neonatal Unit of Paediatric
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Underwent lumbar puncture as part of the workup for sepsis
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Cerebrospinal fluid visibly tinged with blood (macro traumatic). To ensure objectivity, two Pediatricians must have a consensus that the CSF sample is visibly blood-tinged when viewed in bright ambient light.
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: 0.33ng/ml, CSF PCT has a sensitivity of 92%, a specificity of 87%, a positive predictive value (PPV) of 85.2%, and a negative predictive value (NPV) of 93%. We in our study didn't include other CSF conventional parameters for probable meningitis, such as CSF WBC, CSF Sugar, and CSF Protein for the definition of probable meningitis because we intended to study these tests as index tests, and hence they could not also be part of the reference standard.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: COMPARISON OF OUTCOME MEASURES Mentioned elsewhere
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has a history of viral encephalitis/meningitis with ICH, seizure, and stroke. They also have a CSF leak with meningitis s/p lumbar drain placement.
